titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Burhan Dogancay Photograph Collection
1986-1987
PR 183
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Holly Hinman and Kelly McAnnaney

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from dogancay.xml

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T16:56-0500

did.physloc: Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections
did.abstract: Burhan Dogancay photographed the restoration of the Brooklyn Bridge from 1986 to 1987.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Burhan Dogancay and Angela Dogancay, 10 June 2002.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in Print Room for details.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to reproduce any Print Room holdings through publication must be obtained from:
Rights and Reproductions The New-York Historical Society
Two West 77th Street
New York, NY 10024
Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282
Fax: (212) 579-8794

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as: Burhan Dogancay Photograph Collection, PR 183, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Burhan Dogancay was born in Istanbul in 1929. During the early 1950s, he studied economics and law at the University of Paris and art at La Grande Chaumiere. In 1964 Dogancay moved to New York City, making it his permanent home. Noted primarily as an important painter, Burhan Dogancay's career spans nearly four decades and remains a work in progress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Burhan Dogancay Photograph Collection is exclusively drawn from Dogancay's book Bridge of Dreams: The Rebirth of the Brooklyn Bridge, New York: Hudson Hills Press, 1999, in which all of the photographs in this collection were published. The collection contains 10 platinum prints taken in 1986-1987 during the Brooklyn Bridge's restoration. These images feature the bridge as well as ironworkers and the New York City skyline.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged according to the page number in which they appear in Bridge of Dreams.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections
relatedmaterial.p: Copies of the book Bridge of Dreams: The Rebirth of the Brooklyn Bridge can be found in the reference collection of the Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections.
